page.title: 04FARMING IN TEESDALE
page.content: Farming is one of the mainstays of Barnard Castle and many farms are estate owned.Raby is the main landlord.Their farms are whitewashed. Many farms have changed from dairy farming to meat production.The farmers want maximum grass yield per acre and grow barley and yellow oil seed rape for winter feed.{Richard Buck}is in our class.He and his family,his mother ,father and two brothers own Quarry Grange Farm.They breed cows and sheep for meat.The farm is 150 acres, mainly fertilised grass-land.They have 16 breeding cows,mainly Fresians, but also buy calves to fatten up.They have 100 breeding yews and 2 rams.About 120 lambs are born each Spring.Mr.Buck grows 3 large fields of barley for winter feed.The Goat's milk is used to feed pet lambs.Lambing time in February and haymaking in July.
